zone.line: MS. Shelley e.1
excite your audience to the highest
degree; when for instance you sing of
Ulysses leaping upon the threshold of
his home, & when bursting like a phantom
upon the suitors he pours forth his
arrows before his feet; or of Achilles
rushing upon Hector, or some pathetic
passage relating to Andromache
Hecuba or Priam; do you then
feel that you are in your senses, or
are you not as it were out of
yourself, & is not your soul
transported into the midst of
the action which it paints in
its enthusiasm, whether in Ithaca
or in Troy, or whatever other place
may be the scene of the epic
you recite? X
